Description: Fragment (one of three) of a polychrome tomb-painting divided into two registers: upper - six women seated at a banquet; lower - five musicians seated on the ground with remains of nine vertical registers of hieroglyphic text above.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Rev George Waddington
Field Collection by: Rev Barnard Hanbury
Curator's comments: Published: PM I Part 2, p. 817; N. Strudwick, Masterpieces of Ancient Egypt, London 2006, pp. 172-3. Full publication: R. Parkinson, The Painted Tomb-Chapel of Nebamun: Masterpieces of Ancient Egyptian Art in the British Museum (London: British Museum Press 2008). A. Middleton and K. Uprichard (ed.), The Nebamun Wall paintings: Conservation, Scientific Analysis and Display at the British Museum (London: Archetype 2008).
Acquisition notes: Acquired by Waddington and Hanbury in Egypt in 1821.
Additional IDs: Other BM number: EA175 (original Big Number)
